title.narrative: MENSTRUAL HYGIENE

description.narrative: Communities and schools have strengthened capacity to ensure adequate information on, and appropriate facilities for, menstrual hygiene for adolescent and pre-adolescent girls, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Sanitation, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: WATER, SANITATION & HYGIENE- Improved and equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation, and healthy environments and improved hygiene practices in deprived provinces and vulnerable areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities and schools have strengthened capacity to ensure adequate information on, and appropriate facilities for, menstrualhygiene for adolescent and pre-adolescent girls

description.narrative: A total of 104 formal schools gained access to WASH facilities benefitting 105,110students (47,299 girls and 57,811 boys). 37 Health Centers were provided with a basic WASH package benefitting a catchment population of 555,000 people (271,950 females and 283,050 males). Additionally, 5,219 staff members (1,566 females and 3,654 males) in 160 health centers received hygiene behaviour change communication through the Health Center Hygiene Programme (HCHP). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
